de.unlixx.runpng.scene

Class FramesBox

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.Node
      • javafx.scene.Parent
        • javafx.scene.layout.Region
          • javafx.scene.layout.Pane
            • javafx.scene.layout.HBox
              • de.unlixx.runpng.scene.FramesBox
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget

    public class FramesBox
extends javafx.scene.layout.HBox
    Implementation of a FramesBox to show a sequence of FramePane objects. This is a horizontal box with unlimited maximum width. So it needes to be content of a ScrollPane. The added FramePane objects can be dragged by the user to change their order.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FramesBox

        public FramesBox(javafx.scene.control.ScrollPane scroller,
                 double dSpacing)
        Constructor for this FramesBox. It needs a reference to the ScrollPane, which it is content of, in order to run a scrollIntoView(Node) method.
        Parameters:
        scroller - A ScrollPane object which this FramesBox is content of.
        dSpacing - A double containing the space between the FramePane cildren.

    • Method Detail

      • setAdjusting

        public void setAdjusting(boolean bAdjusting)
        Sets the adjusting flag in order to don't start actions caused by adjusting operations.
        Parameters:
        bAdjusting - True if the following operations shall be ignored by change listeners and similar.

      • addFrame

        public void addFrame(FramePane pane)
        Adds a FramePane to the end of the children list.
        Parameters:
        pane - An object of type FramePane.

      • addFrame

        public void addFrame(FramePane pane,
                     int nIdx)
        Adds a FramePane to the given index of the children list. The following FramePanes will be shifted by 1.
        Parameters:
        pane - An object of type FramePane.
        nIdx - The index where to add.

      • removeFrame

        public FramePane removeFrame(int nIdx)
        Removes a FramePane from the children list.
        Parameters:
        nIdx - The index of the pane to remove.
        Returns:
        The removed FramePane object.

      • getFrame

        public FramePane getFrame(int nIdx)
        Gets a FramePane at the given index.
        Parameters:
        nIdx - The index of the pane to get.
        Returns:
        A FramePane object.

      • getFramesCount

        public int getFramesCount()
        Gets the current number of FramePanes managed.
        Returns:
        An int containing the number of FramePanes.

      • getSelectedFrame

        public FramePane getSelectedFrame()
        Gets the currently selected FramePane.
        Returns:
        A FramePane object. Or null if none is selected.

      • getSelectedIndex

        public int getSelectedIndex()
        Gets the currently selected index.
        Returns:
        An int containing the index of the selected FramePane. Or -1 if none is selected.

      • setSelectedIndex

        public FramePane setSelectedIndex(int nIdx)
        Sets the currently selection index.
        Parameters:
        nIdx - An int containing the index of the selected FramePane.
        Returns:
        A FramePane object. Or null if the index is out of bounds.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Removes all FramePanes from the children list.

      • scrollIntoView

        public void scrollIntoView(javafx.scene.Node node)
        Scrolls the given Node object, usually a FramePane, into the visible part of the ScrollPane which this FramesBox is content of. If the given Node is already completely shown in the viewport then this method does nothing.
        Parameters:
        node - A Node object.

      • doChangeListening

        protected void doChangeListening()
        Implements a change listener for removing and adding of child nodes.

      • setOnFramesChange

        public void setOnFramesChange(javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.event.ActionEvent> handler)
        Sets an EventHandler to handle changes of the children list.
        Parameters:
        handler - The EventHandler.

      • onFramesChange

        protected void onFramesChange()
        Invokes an Eventhandler in case of changes in the children list.

      • doDragListening

        protected void doDragListening()
        Does the drag listening with multiple event filters.

      • refreshPaneNumbers

        protected void refreshPaneNumbers()
        Renumber all FramePanes.

      • getFrameFromPoint

        protected FramePane getFrameFromPoint(javafx.geometry.Point2D pt)
        Find a FramePane at the given point.
        Parameters:
        pt - An object of type Point2D.
        Returns:
        The FramePane from the given point. Or null if there is none.
